name: Falafel with Canned Chickpeas
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': '(15 ounce) cans', 'name': 'chickpeas, drained'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onions, chopped'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh parsley'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'eggs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'ground coriander'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'ground black pepper, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'cayenne pepper, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'bread crumbs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'olive oil, or as needed'}
steps: Gather all ingredients.. Mash chickpeas in a bowl using a masher. Combine mashed chickpeas, onions, parsley, and garlic in a blender; blend until smooth.. Mix eggs, cumin, coriander, salt, lemon juice, baking powder, black pepper, and cayenne together in a bowl. Add chickpea mixture and mix together. Add bread crumbs slowly and combine using your hands until mixture will hold together when frying.. Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Form mixture into twelve 3-inch diameter patties. Fry patties in hot oil until browned, 3 to 4 minutes per side.

name: Ta'ameya (Egyptian Falafel)
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'dried split fava beans'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red onion, quartered'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh parsley'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh cilantro'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh dill'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'ground coriander'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sesame seeds (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'quart', 'name': 'vegetable oil for frying, or as needed'}
steps: Place fava beans into large bowl and cover with several inches of water. Let soak, 8 hours to overnight. Drain.. Combine soaked fava beans, red onion, parsley, cilantro, dill, garlic, coriander, salt, and cumin in a food processor; process to a dough-like consistency.. Heat a skillet over medium heat. Add sesame seeds; cook, stirring occasionally, until toasted, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a large plate.. Shape fava bean mixture into about 50 balls. Roll balls in sesame seeds to coat.. Fill a large saucepan 1/4 full with oil; heat over medium heat. Fry fava bean balls in batches until golden brown, 3 to 5 minutes per batch. Drain on paper towels.

name: Sean's Falafel and Cucumber Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(6 ounce) container', 'name': 'plain yogurt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cucumber - peeled, seeded, and finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'mayonnaise (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried dill weed'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'name': 'chickpeas (garbanzo beans), drained'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh parsley'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'egg'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground coriander'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dry bread crumbs, or as needed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'oil, or as needed, for frying'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'pita breads, cut in half (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped tomatoes (Optional)'}
steps: Make sauce: Combine yogurt, cucumber, mayonnaise, dill, salt, and pepper in a small bowl; mix well. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.. Make falafel: Mash chickpeas in a large bowl until thick and pasty; do not use a blender as the consistency will be too thin.. Place onion, parsley, and garlic in a blender; blend until smooth. Stir into mashed chickpeas until well combined.. Combine egg, cumin, coriander, salt, lemon juice, baking powder, black pepper, and cayenne in a small bowl. Stir into chickpea mixture along with olive oil. Mix in bread crumbs, a little at a time, until mixture holds together but is not sticky. Form mixture into 8 balls, then flatten into falafel patties.. Heat 1 inch oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Fry falafels in hot oil until brown on both sides. Serve 2 falafels in each pita half, topped with chopped tomatoes and sauce.

name: Chef John's Falafel
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dry garbanzo beans'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'yellow onion, diced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'minced garlic'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'all-purpose flour, or more as needed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'salt, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground coriander'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'baking soda'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'oil for frying'}
steps: Place garbanzo beans into a large container and cover with several inches of cool water; let stand 12 to 24 hours. Drain.. Blend garbanzo beans, onion, parsley, garlic, flour, lemon juice, salt, cumin, coriander, baking soda, and cayenne pepper together in a food processor, scraping down the sides of the bowl as necessary, until mixture is finely ground and holds together when pressed. Transfer garbanzo mixture to a bowl, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate until flavors blend, 1 to 2 hours.. Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).. Divide dough into 12 portions and roll each with moistened hands into a ball.. Working in batches, cook falafel balls in hot oil until browned and crispy, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a wire rack to drain.

name: Falafels with Yogurt-Dill Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'name': 'chickpeas (garbanzo beans), drained and mashed with fork'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'panko bread crumbs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'unpeeled red potato, shredded'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'diced red onion'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'egg'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chopped fresh cilantro'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'panko bread crumbs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'canola oil for frying'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'plain yogurt'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh dill'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'lemon, juiced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'garlic salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground white pepper'}
steps: Combine chickpeas, 3/4 cup panko bread crumbs, red potato, red onion, garlic, egg, 1 tablespoon olive oil, cilantro, 1 teaspoon lemon juice, cumin, salt, and black pepper in a large bowl.. Form mixture into 2-inch patties. Place 1/4 cup panko crumbs in a shallow bowl. Gently press patties into the crumbs to coat.. Heat canola oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.. Fry patties in the hot oil until golden brown, about 4 minutes per side. Set patties aside.. Stir yogurt, dill, lemon juice, garlic salt, and white pepper together in a bowl. Serve sauce drizzled over falafels.

name: Baked Falafel
ingredients: {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'name': 'garbanzo beans, rinsed and drained'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh parsley'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground coriander'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'baking soda'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'egg, beaten'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}
steps: Wrap onion in cheese cloth and squeeze out as much moisture as possible. Set aside. Place garbanzo beans, parsley, garlic, cumin, coriander, salt, and baking soda in a food processor. Process until the mixture is coarsely pureed. Mix garbanzo bean mixture and onion together in a bowl. Stir in the flour and egg. Shape mixture into four large patties and let stand for 15 minutes.. Preheat an oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).. Heat olive oil in a large, oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat. Place the patties in the skillet; cook until golden brown, about 3 minutes on each side.. Transfer skillet to the preheated oven and bake until heated through, about 10 minutes.

name: Air Fryer Falafel
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dry garbanzo beans'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'fresh cilantro, stems removed'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh flat-leafed parsley, stems removed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red onion, quartered'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chickpea flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'ground coriander'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'riracha sauce'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'baking soda'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cooking spray'}
steps: Soak chickpeas in a large amount of cool water for 24 hours. Rub the soaked chickpeas with your fingers to help loosen and remove skins. Rinse and drain well. Spread chickpeas on a large clean dish towel to dry.. Blend chickpeas, cilantro, parsley, onion, and garlic in a food processor until a rough paste forms. Transfer mixture to a large bowl. Add chickpea flour, coriander, cumin, Sriracha, salt, and pepper and mix well. Cover bowl and let mixture rest for 1 hour.. Preheat an air fryer to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).. Add baking powder and baking soda to the chickpea mixture. Mix using your hands until just combined. Form 15 equal-sized balls and press slightly to form patties. Spray falafel patties with cooking spray.. Place 7 falafel patties in the preheated air fryer and cook for 10 minutes. Transfer cooked falafel to a plate and repeat with remaining 8 falafel, cooking for 10 to 12 minutes.

name: Waffled Falafel
ingredients: {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cooking spray'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(15 ounce) cans', 'name': 'garbanzo beans (chickpeas), drained and rinsed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'large egg whites'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh cilantro'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh parsley'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'roasted garlic, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1 ¾', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground coriander'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'ground cardamom'}
steps: Preheat a waffle iron according to manufacturer's instructions. Spray the inside of the waffle iron with cooking spray.. Process garbanzo beans in a food processor until coarsely chopped. Add onion, egg whites, cilantro, parsley, garlic, flour, cumin, salt, coriander, black pepper, cayenne pepper, and cardamom to garbanzo beans. Pulse, scraping down the sides of the bowl occasionally, until falafel batter resembles a coarse meal. Pour batter into a bowl and stir with a fork.. Spoon about 1/4 cup falafel batter onto each section of the preheated waffle iron. Cook until evenly browned, about 5 minutes. Repeat with remaining batter.

name: Easy Baked Falafel with Cucumber-Yogurt Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cooking spray'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil, divided'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'name': 'chickpeas, drained and rinsed'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, diced'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'packed chopped fresh cilantro'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'packed chopped fresh parsley'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, smashed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'small lemon, zested'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'kosher salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'red pepper flakes'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'egg, beaten'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'plain Greek yogurt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'seeded and minced cucumber, squeezed dry'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'minced garlic'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'cayenne pepper, or to taste'}
steps: Coat a 9x13-inch metal baking pan with cooking spray and 1 tablespoon olive oil and place inside the oven. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). C. Combine chickpeas, onion, cilantro, parsley, garlic, lemon zest, cumin, salt, red pepper flakes, and baking powder in a food processor. Pulse until minced but not yet pasty. Transfer to a bowl and stir in flour and egg until fully incorporated.. Remove baking pan from the oven. Drop golfball-sized portions of chickpea mixture onto the hot pan.. Bake in the preheated oven 15 to 20 minutes. Brush falafel with remaining olive oil and flip over. Continue baking until golden on both sides, 15 to 20 minutes more.. Meanwhile, combine yogurt, cucumber, lemon juice, and garlic in a bowl. Season with salt and cayenne pepper. Store in the refrigerator until ready to serve.. Serve falafel with yogurt sauce.

name: Jeanie's Falafel
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(19 ounce) can', 'name': 'garbanzo beans, rinsed and drained'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped fresh cilantro'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried parsley'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fine dry bread crumbs'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'cracked black peppercorns'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'quart', 'name': 'vegetable oil for frying'}
steps: Mash the garbanzo beans in a large bowl. Stir in the onion, garlic, cilantro, parsley, cumin, turmeric, baking powder, bread crumbs, salt and pepper. Do not be afraid to use your hands. Shape the mixture into 1 1/2 inch balls; you should get 18 to 24. If the mixture does not hold together, add a little water.. Heat the oil in a deep fryer to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Carefully drop the balls into the hot oil, and fry until brown. If you do not have a deep fryer, heat the oil in a heavy deep skillet over medium-high heat. You may need to adjust the heat slightly after the first couple of falafels, and be sure to turn frequently so they brown evenly.

name: Easiest Falafel
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(16 ounce) can', 'name': 'garbanzo beans, drained'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'panko bread crumbs, or as needed'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped onion'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'egg'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'dried parsley'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'curry powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'garlic powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'panko bread crumbs, or as needed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil for frying, or as needed'}
steps: Place garbanzo beans, 1/4 cup panko bread crumbs, onion, 1/4 cup olive oil, egg, parsley, curry powder, garlic powder, lemon juice, and black pepper in a food processor or blender. Puree until coarse crumbles form. Blend more panko crumbs into mixture if it is too moist.. Roll mixture into balls about the size of a golf ball; place on a plate.. Press into patties and coat in panko bread crumbs.. Heat about 1-inch olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.. Pan-fry patties until crispy, about 3 minutes on each side.

name: Air Fried Falafel
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(15.5 ounce) can', 'name': 'chickpeas, rinsed and drained'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'yellow onion, quartered'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'roughly chopped parsley'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped scallions'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'roughly chopped cilantro'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'kosher salt'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'crushed red pepper flakes'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'olive oil cooking spray'}
steps: Dry chickpeas on paper towels. Place onions and garlic in the bowl of a food processor fitted with a steel blade. Add parsley, scallions, cilantro, cumin, salt, and red pepper flakes. Process until blended, 30 to 60 seconds, then add the chickpeas and pulse 2 to 3 times until just blended, but not pureed. Sprinkle in flour and baking powder, scrape the sides of the bowl down with a spatula, and pulse 2 to 3 times.. Transfer to a bowl and refrigerate, covered, 2 to 3 hours.. Form the falafel mixture into 12 balls; if mixture is too sticky add some flour to your hands and your work surface.. Preheat an air fryer to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) according to manufacturer's instructions. Spray falafel with cooking spray.. Cook in the preheated air fryer until golden brown, about 14 minutes, turning halfway through.

name: Authentic Falafels
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dried chickpeas'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'baking soda'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1 ⅓', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'sesame seeds'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground coriander'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'red chili powder'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'asafoetida powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'quart', 'name': 'vegetable oil for frying, or as needed'}
steps: Place dried chickpeas in a bowl. Fill with water to cover; stir in baking soda. Soak at least 8 hours or overnight in refrigerator. Drain.. Place soaked and drained chickpeas in a blender or food processor; blend to a paste.. Pour water into chickpea paste and blend until smooth. Scrape down sides of blender with spatula if needed.. Place sesame seeds, cumin, salt, baking powder, coriander, black pepper, red chili powder, sugar, turmeric, and asafoetida powder in blender with chickpea paste; blend until well mixed. Transfer chickpea mixture to a bowl.. Chill chickpea mixture in refrigerator to allow flavors to blend, at least 1 hour and up to two days.. Pour vegetable oil to a depth of 1 inch in a deep skillet over medium heat and heat to 370 degrees F (188 degrees C).. Scoop up chickpea mixture by heaping tablespoons and form into balls the size of ping pong balls.. Fry balls in hot oil until golden brown, 3 to 5 minutes on each side.

name: 12 Best Falafel Recipes from Classic Sandwiches to Falafel Waffles and Pizza
Spicy Baked Falafel with Tzatziki
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(32 ounce) container', 'name': 'Greek yogurt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'cucumber, peeled and finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'freshly squeezed lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'garlic powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'white sugar (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'lemon zest'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'leaves', 'name': 'fresh mint, finely chopped, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'chopped fresh dill'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'whole jalapeno peppers'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'parsley'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'green onions, root ends removed'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'peeled garlic'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '(16 ounce) cans', 'name': 'chickpeas - rinsed, drained, and dried'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'eggs'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'freshly squeezed lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'lemon zest'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'Greek seasoning'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'salt, divided'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'smoked paprika'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chile powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chickpea flour'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil, divided'}
steps: Stir yogurt, cucumber, lemon juice, garlic powder, sugar, lemon zest, mint, and dill together in a bowl. Adjust seasonings to taste and refrigerate tzatziki until ready to serve with falafel.. Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).. Combine jalapeno peppers, parsley, green onions, and garlic in a food processor. Pulse until finely chopped and fully blended. Scrape mixture down and add chickpeas. Pulse several times until just blended and chickpeas are broken up, but texture is still rough; do not overblend. Transfer mixture to a large bowl.. Add eggs, lemon juice, lemon zest, Greek seasoning, cumin, 1/2 tablespoon salt, paprika, pepper, and chili powder to the chickpea mixture. Stir with a spatula until fully incorporated. Add chickpea flour a few tablespoons at a time and stir; the final mixture should be wet, but not falling apart when handled. Place bowl in the freezer, uncovered, to firm up mixture, 10 to 15 minutes.. Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper and brush with some olive oil.. Remove chickpea mixture from freezer and form into 20 to 24 small balls and place on the prepared baking sheet. Brush falafel with remaining olive oil and sprinkle with remaining salt.. Bake in the preheated oven until falafel are dry and slightly darker brown in color, about 45 minutes. Turn on the broiler and continue baking until tops are crisp, 5 to 7 minutes. Serve with tzatziki.

name: Falafel Hash
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'extra-virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': '', 'name': 'mushrooms, halved and sliced'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'garlic cloves, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'yam, peeled and cubed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'ground coriander'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'onion (nigella) seeds'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'black mustard seeds'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'chile powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'paprika'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'head', 'name': 'cauliflower, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'name': 'chickpeas, drained'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable stock'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'fresh spinach, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'fresh parsley, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'lemon, juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'lime, juiced'}
steps: Heat oil in a large flat-sided skillet over medium heat. Add onion; cook and stir until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add mushrooms and garlic; cook and stir until softened, about 2 minutes. Add yam and cook for 2 minutes.. Stir cumin, coriander, onion seeds, black mustard seeds, chile powder, paprika, and turmeric into the skillet; cook and stir until evenly distributed, about 2 minutes. Add cauliflower, chickpeas, salt, and black pepper; stir until combined.. Mix vegetable stock and tomato paste together in a small bowl; pour into the skillet. Cover and cook until yam is tender, about 15 minutes. Stir in spinach, parsley, lemon juice, and lime juice and cook until flavors combine, about 1 minute.

name: Air Fryer Falafel (Gluten Free)
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(15.5 ounce) can', 'name': 'chickpeas, drained'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'yellow onion, roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh cilantro'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh parsley'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'almond flour'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'coarse salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'baking soda'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'sesame oil cooking spray'}
steps: Pour chickpeas into the basket of a large air fryer. Cook at 220 degrees F (104 degrees C) until mostly dry, about 15 minutes. Check after 10 minutes of cooking; all liquid should be evaporated and chickpeas should still be squishy, not toasted or hardened. Turn air fryer off.. Transfer chickpeas to a food processor. Add onion, cilantro, parsley, almond flour, garlic, cumin, cayenne, baking powder, salt, pepper, baking soda, and nutmeg. Process on medium-high speed until a chunky paste forms.. Refrigerate mixture to let flavors develop and to enable more drying, at least 30 minutes, or up to 1 hour.. Form mixture into 1 1/4-inch balls. Place in the air fryer basket and spray with sesame oil spray; be careful, falafel will be delicate.. Set the air fryer to 320 degrees F (160 degrees C) and cook for 10 minutes. Coat with more sesame oil if desired, increase temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and cook until outsides are toasted, about 10 more minutes.

name: Southwestern Falafel
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'quart', 'name': 'vegetable oil for frying, or as needed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, quartered'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'green bell pepper, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'egg'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(1.25 ounce) package', 'name': 'dry taco seasoning mix'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'peanut oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(16 ounce) can', 'name': 'pinto beans, drained'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'hot sauce, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dry bread crumbs, or more as needed'}
steps: Heat vegetable oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).. Place onion, green bell pepper, egg, garlic, taco seasoning, baking powder, peanut oil, cumin, salt, and cayenne pepper in a food processor. Puree until smooth.. Pour pinto beans into mixture and pulse until pinto beans are chopped and integrated, but not smooth.. Transfer bean mixture to a large bowl; stir hot sauce into mixture.. Stir enough bread crumbs into mixture to form a dough that holds together, but isn't sticky.. Form dough into quarter-sized balls.. Deep-fry in hot oil until falafel are deep brown, about 3 to 5 minutes.

name: Falafel Dough Pizza
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'red lentils'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, quartered'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, peeled'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'fresh parsley'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'fresh cilantro'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped green onions'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'egg'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'chile powder'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground coriander'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'yogurt'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'tahini'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt to taste'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded Cheddar cheese'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'tomato, cubed'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sliced olives'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'minced fresh parsley'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'minced green onion'}
steps: Place red lentils in a bowl and cover with water. Let soak until softened, about 2 hours. Drain.. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and grease with 2 teaspoons oil.. Place lentils in a food processor with onion, garlic, 1/2 bunch parsley, cilantro, and 1/4 cup green onions; pulse until finely ground.. Transfer lentil mixture to a large bowl. Add 1/3 cup oil, egg, baking powder, black pepper, chile powder, cumin, coriander, and salt; mix until well-blended. Spread dough to 1/4-inch thickness onto prepared baking sheet.. Bake in the preheated oven until golden and firm, about 15 minutes. Remove from oven.. Combine yogurt, lemon juice, tahini, and salt in a small bowl; mix well until sauce is smooth.. Layer sauce, Cheddar cheese, tomato, olives, 1 tablespoon parsley, and 2 teaspoons green onion on top of baked dough.. Return to the oven and bake until cheese is melted, about 5 minutes.
